intro: Denisophytum bessac, commonly known as the Bessac's denisophyte, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and unique ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
